page.title: 09ECOLOGY.
page.content: Apart from Althorp Park which are the grounds of Althorp House,the area is undulating farm and grass land with several pockets of woodland.Walkers should beware of large hidden holes where thick undergrowth has colonised old quarries. Harlestone Firs is unique in the County.Lying on a belt of acid sands, most of the trees are conifers.It is a popular haunt for walkers,horse riders and nature lovers;a nature trail opening up in the 1970s. There are many footpaths and bridle ways especially around Harlestone.The main footpaths are clearly marked with gates and metalled surfaces. The climate is equable with less than average rainfall.
